Caption: Figure 1: GeoTime system for analysis of events and transactions in time and space. Time is in the vertical dimension.

Figure 4: Analysis of phone calls in the 2006 VAST fictitious contest scenario reveals the sequence of communications, financial transactions, and other relationships, including interactions that cross boundaries between commercial, government and personal realms.

Figure 2: Illustration of a process in an X, Y, T coordinate space. Instances of process events are shown above the labeled process diagram. Time is in the vertical dimension. Repetition of some steps is visible. A persons involvement throughout the process is shown as a trail in red.
Figure 3: A temporal view of the authors’ travel and calls over 8 months, arranged geospatially (left) and by theme (right)
Figure 6: A graph of the GeoTime knowledge base reveals plots in this complex scenario. Plot outlines and labels added by the authors.
Figure 5: Schematic representation of (a) phone call in GeoTime, (b) knowledge representation diagram equivalent, and (c) entities-only generated view.
Figure 8: Temporal view of activity in a computer network in GeoTime. Note the summary network image on the groundplane, with constituent network activity as events above in the Z-axis.
Figure 9: Interaction events between characters in Romeo and Juliet over time, filtered to only show those connected to the Nurse.
